Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, sport.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I heard someone got engaged, you dog, huh? [punches Michael's shoulder]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ow! God!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, nothing can hurt you now. You're a man in love!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I was there. That dude is not engaged. I'm not a big believer in therapy, but I'll go into my own pocket to cover his co-pay.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Big idea: double wedding. Me, Angela, you, Holly.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, we would never do that. And if we did, it would be with Jim and Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, we'd never do that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, so there you go.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [enters Michael's office] Michael, I got my bridesmaid dress.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, wow, so quickly.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Yeah, and you said I could get it in any color I wanted, so I picked white.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Michael, did you tell your mom yet?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nope. Nope. Not yet.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You wouldn't tell your mom?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: You love your mom.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Call your mom, Michael. [everyone talking]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'll call her later.

Quote.Speaker: Group
Quote.Text: [chanting and clapping] Call her! Call her!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't want to do that. [chanting continues] All right. [picks up phone and dials] She is going to freak out!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [punches button] Speakerphone!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's -- thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Mother
Quote.Text: [on speakerphone] Hello?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mom, I'm getting married.

Quote.Speaker: Mother
Quote.Text: No, you're not.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why do you always do that? Whenever I'm getting married, you don't believe me.

Quote.Speaker: Mother
Quote.Text: Well, are you getting married?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Mother
Quote.Text: Are you- [Michael ends call]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm not, I'm not getting married. So... [laughs] Psych.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: So I returned my bridesmaid dress, and it was on sale, so I'm out $100.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And I'm out a fiancee. Are those the customer surveys?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Yeah, uh, this is all of them: Jim, Dwight, Phyllis, Stanley, Andy and -- oh. Oh, it's the receipt to my bridesmaid dress. What's that doing there? [hands stack of papers to Michael]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'll take care of that for you. [crumples receipt and throws it in trash] Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Kelly Kapoor is our dusky, exotic customer service rep. And once a year, she will contact our clients and find out how happy they are with our salespeople. Sort of a Kapoor's List. "Schindler's List" parody. ... That's not appropriate, no.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Those reports affect our bonuses, which is kind of great for me, because you wouldn't know it from looking at her, but Pam's a gold-digger.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [on Bluetooth speaker] Hey, New York ain't free. Get back to work.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Aww.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's the world's tiniest Bluetooth. I found it in a Japanese gadget store in the village. I got one for Jim, too. Jim, say something.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [on Bluetooth] Testing, testing. Hello, everybody.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We wanted to stay on the phone all day, but the company has a policy against eight-hour personal calls. So we're not telling anyone.

Quote.Speaker: Alex
Quote.Text: Uh, Pam. What do you want on your coffee?

Quote.Speaker: Jim and Pam
Quote.Text: Sprinkle of cinnamon.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I should go.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alrighty, Dwighty, let's see how you did.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Bring it on. [starts to put foot up on Michael's desk]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What does it say?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight, your feedback is horrible.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's impossible.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: A number of your clients found your personal style abrasive and distasteful.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I sell more paper than anyone. [stands and reaches for the file]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no, no, no.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wait, is this a joke? I'm getting that queasy feeling that sometimes accompanies jokes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do I look like I am joking?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, but that's sometimes part of it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: If I were joking, you would be laughing. Do you look like you are laughing?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Impossible to say. I can't see myself.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're not.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yo, Tommy Tuna, did you get your scores yet?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nope.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I got mine. They were really good.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [listening in New York] I miss him.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You must be really proud.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, pretty psyched. Whoa! That's my mug.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, sorry. It was just -- it was right here.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Right, well, it's mine, so if you could pour it out and get another one.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK. Or maybe I could finish the coffee that's in here and you could use [finds a mug] uh, oh -- Snoopy.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Don't give him Snoopy. That's mine.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [smiles] It is a great mug. But it's not my mug. That is my mug. So give it back.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: How can you even be sure?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It has my face on it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [holds mug next to Andy's head] Make the face. [Andy smiles] Yeah, I don't see it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Dude, that is my face!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [Dwight slams something on desk] What was that?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow. That was Dwight. He seems upset about something.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Describe him exactly. What color mustard is his shirt? Yellow or Dijon?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It is... more of a spicy brown, actually.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What are you mumbling about?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: How was your meeting with Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: None of your business.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Was it your scores?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Those can't be my scores, Jim. For your information --

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm being sabotaged.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Of course.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And I'm going to find that person and punish them.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Absolutely. Or you could just be nice to your customers.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You're an idiot.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: There's the charm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Jimbo, let's do this thang.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That is me. Wish me luck.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No way.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [whispers on bluetooth] Good luck.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I didn't say anything

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I love you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I love you, too.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What do you think I am saying to you?!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm not talking to you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I've caught Jim talking to himself several times today. What a loser. Get a friend, loser.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [on phone] Yeah, I'm looking at it right now. It's really gorgeous. You guys do great work.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I found the best tentist on the east coast. He personally tented Giuliani's first and third weddings. And I got him. [shakes fist] I got him!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [on phone] Would you be able to do the same design, but with walls of gray? And a top that's gray too? Fabulous.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, come on.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You too?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Did my scores drop a little?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Jim, they are a poopy. [Jim coughs, presses button to end call on Bluetooth]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [touches ear] Jim? Jim?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Are we even sure that's my file?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. [glances at it] Yes, I am sure, Jim. It --

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, there's got to be an explanation.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I agree.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So let's see what we can find out from reading. [reads] Jim Halpert is smudge and arrogant.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I think you mean smug

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [points at Jim] Arrogance.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Michael, I'm just trying to --

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And there's our smudgeness.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I need a decent bonus, because I'm actually in the process of buying my parents' house so that they can retire. And if history tells us anything, it's that you can't go wrong buying a house you can't afford. Pam doesn't know about the house, so it's... a fun surprise. [taps Bluetooth earpiece] Pam, sorry about that. I lost you for a second. So, as it turns out, I may not have done so hot on my customer reviews this year.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Maybe it's because you spent the whole year flirting with the receptionist.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: A little bit. ... Worth it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Here's what's going to happen. I am going to have to fix you, manage you two on a more personal scale, a more micro form of management. Jim, what is that called?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Microgement.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Boom! Yes. Now, Jim is going to be the client. Dwight, you're going to have to sell to him without being aggressive, hostile or difficult. Let's go.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: All right, fine. [picks up phone] Brrring.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [picks up phone] Hello?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hello, this is Dwight Schrute from the Dunder Mifflin Paper Company.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow, that's great, because I need paper.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Excellent, then you are in luck, because we are having a limited-time offer only on everything.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow, this is my lucky day.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [whispers] Ask him his name.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What is your name, sir?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I am Bill Buttlicker.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Really, that's your real name?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: How dare you? My family built this country, by the way.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Be respectful, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Would you hold on one second? That's my other line.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What? No, but I --

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hello? [laughs] No, I'm just on the phone with this stupid salesman. He's so dumb. Probably just gonna keep him on the line forever and not buy anything. Yeah, OK. [punches button on phone]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's up to you to change his mind.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Sorry. That was a family emergency.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, no. What's wrong?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know what? That's private.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Boundaries, Dwight. Come on!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Sorry, Mr. Buttlicker. As I was saying, we're having a limited-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Sorry, you're going to have to speak up a little bit louder. I'm hard of hearing.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: He's hard of -- he's an old man. Let's go.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: OK, as I was saying, right now we are having --

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You're gonna have to talk louder.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: OK, our prices have never been lower.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Son, you have to talk louder.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: ...never been lower!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Louder, son!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [shouting] Buttlicker! Our prices have never been lower!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Stop it! Stop it!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: He --

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That is totally inappropriate. You never yell at the client. You never yell at the client.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Now, you listen to me, sir.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Here we go.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: The three words I would describe you as is aggressive, hostile and definitely difficult.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Give me the phone.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Please, Mr. Buttlicker --

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm irate right now.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Give me the phone.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Please give me another chance. Mr. Buttlicker.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Give me the phone. Give me the phone.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I have to put you on with my boss.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, I should hope so. [Michael takes phone] Who is this?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hello, this is Michael Scott, regional manager.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, this is William M. Buttlicker.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hello, Mr. Buttlicker. How may we help you?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Michael, I like the sound of your voice. You know what I'm going to do? I'm going to buy one million dollars worth of paper products today.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [shakes fist, whispers] Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [covers phone, whispers to Dwight] See how it's done? [into phone] Thank you very much, sir. I don't think you'll regret it. [to Dwight] See what I did?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You are the master.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: There is one condition, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You have to fire the salesman that treated me so terribly.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Don't do it, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ... [whispers] It's a million-dollar sale.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: So it's called the Shangri-La Tent. It's two stories, heated and has a bridal suite for my bridal sweet. It's just really simple, really tasteful.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I don't want to be married in a tent like a hobo

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hobos live in trains.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Nana Mimi can't be in canvas that long.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, Nana Mim -- Ahh. OK, look. This tent is awesome. And it's in high demand, so I really think we should put a deposit down now.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: OK fine you can have your tent, but only if it's in a field, a hand-plowed field

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Done and done-er.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: There has to be a barn that's old enough that you can see the stars through the roof slats when you lay on your back. And antique tools to look at when you roll over.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Do you have a specific place in mind?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No. But anything within a five- to eight-mile radius is acceptable.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: On it!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight. Dwight. [Dwight's car comes screeching into view]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Get in!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Are you serious?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Get in! [he peels off into parking space]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK, what are you --

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Shh. [turns radio up loud, playing "Centerfold."] They might be listening to us.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What's that?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: They might be listening to us

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Who's they?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Customer service might be monitoring this conversation.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: In this car?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You never know. Better safe than sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [turns radio down] What are you thinking?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Who stands to benefit from our downfall?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: The mob, maybe NASA.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Could be the mob. But then Dunder-Mifflin would need to be a front for money laundering, and there's little evidence of that.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Is there some evidence?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [on Bluetooth] Ooh, cute shoes online.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: How many shoes do you need?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I don't know. Two, maybe three if one wears out. How many shoes do you need?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm not talking to you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Who are you talking to?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: She's not here, Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, she's not.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [in New York, humming to herself to the tune of "Centerfold"] Na na na na na. Na na na na na na na.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [at computer, spins chair around and makes triumphant gesture] Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I found it. I found the perfect place. A local bed-and-breakfast on a 60-acre beet farm. And even better, I have an in with the owner. Oh, yeah. We work together. It's Dwight Schrute. As in Schrute Farms.

Quote.Speaker: Customer
Quote.Text: [on phone] So I'd like to redouble my order, if you could put me down for, um --

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wait, shut up.

Quote.Speaker: Customer
Quote.Text: I'm sorry?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Shh. Do you hear that?

Quote.Speaker: Customer
Quote.Text: Hear what?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Breathing. Is that you?

Quote.Speaker: Customer
Quote.Text: Well, I am breathing, yes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, stop. Hold your breath. I still hear it. Who's there? Kelly, is that you? Hold on. [puts down phone and runs away]

Quote.Speaker: Customer
Quote.Text: I need paper.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [jumps into Kelly's area] Ha! [Kelly screams in surprise]

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh, my God. You scared me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hear anything interesting?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: What are you talking about?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [laughs] I think you know.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: You always say that, and I almost never know.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What are you up to, girl? Huh? Phyllis put you up to this? Stanley? Are they paying you?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Are you accusing me of something?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Of course I am. I know you're the mastermind, but you're too stupid to do it by yourself.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [behind Dwight]:

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [enters breakroom] Hey. Sorry about Dwight, by the way.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Yeah, he's weird.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, we all handle it differently. I personally choose to handle it like a normal person, but...

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: OK.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, how are you and Darryl?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Um, we're cool. [gets up to leave] Bye.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Bye.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [on Bluetooth] That was weird.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What was?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Have you ever had a conversation with Kelly where she didn't go on for 15 minutes without taking a breath?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, actually.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Did you do something to her?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't think so.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, something's off.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, how's things?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Living in the moment.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Do you have any reason to believe that Kelly would be mad at me?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I don't play the politics game anymore, Jim. Can I tell you something? I played it full on in New York. I played it high stakes. For keeps. Made it to the top. But look what it cost. [takes sip of coffee] Can I tell you what else I learned?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wait, that's pretty weird.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, Andy has a mug just like that.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah, Kelly gave them out as party favors. Remember? You got one.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No. What party?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Her America's Got Talent finale party over the summer. [Jim makes face] That's crazy. It was packed. I thought everyone was there. You were there. I remember you being there.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I wasn't. But thank you. [to Pam] Do you know anything about this party?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes, I said you definitely should go, but you wanted to visit me instead.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, I can't be the only one who didn't -- [sees mugs on Angela's and Meredith's desks]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [walks quickly to break room, opens cabinet and finds mugs of Oscar, Creed and Phyllis]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight, let me see your coffee cup.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No. [holds Sheriff's Department mug protectively]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Is that it?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No. Why? No. [puts it in desk drawer and slams it shut]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK, I'm gonna assume that was it. Here's the thing:

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [in New York] Right Dwight is loud.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I knew it! Yeah! Ha-ha! Woo! [kicks near Phyllis' head; she ducks] Boom! Kelly the whole time. Let's get her.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, no, no, no. Dwight, Dwight, Dwight. Let's talk about this.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: What's going on?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why don't you tell us?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Nothing's going on.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Let me paint you a picture of a little girl from southern India, who despite being welcomed into this country will now spend the rest of her life in prison for a crime she did commit.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight. [to Kelly] I was informed by these gentlemen that the reports that you filed may not entirely be accurate.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: What? I -- I don't know what you're talking about. This is the first I'm hearing about this.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, come on. You juked the stats, cupcake.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We called about a dozen customers, and they all said that they gave us great marks.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What's going on?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I love your tie, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [looks momentarily flattered, but thinks better of it] Kelly.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I was raped.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You cannot say "I was raped" and expect all of your problems to go away, Kelly. Not again. Don't keep doing that. I'll give you one last chance to come clean. Just tell me what happened.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: OK, all right. OK, I did it. All right? I lied, whatever. Just fire me. But you know what? I did it because you guys didn't come to my party, and you said you would try to and then you didn't even show up, and so you're bad friends.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: We have our confession. I'm calling security. [reaches for phone]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Don't. Don't. Get away from that, Dwight, please. You know what? She's got a point about you two. You do have a problem dealing with people.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: See? I wasn't lying.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You were lying.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I was lying.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes. Jim, Dwight, please excuse us.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I want to be here when you fire her ass.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I will call you when it is time. [Jim and Dwight leave]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I have an enormous amount of trouble trying to get people to come to my place. And I hate it. I can't tell you how much leftover guacamole I have ended up eating over the years. I don't even know why I make it in such great quantities. Here's what we're gonna do. We are going to sit here for a while, make it look good. And maybe you should cry. Can you make yourself cry?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: No problem.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I think you should do that. [Kelly starts fake-crying, then laughing, then she and Michael both laugh]

Quote.Speaker: Alex
Quote.Text: Pam Beesley?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, what are you doing here?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Who's that?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's Alex.

Quote.Speaker: Alex
Quote.Text: It's Pam. Uh, I came to kidnap you. There's free wine and cheese at the Chuck Close retrospective. Let's go.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, that's gonna be great. Who's Chuck Close?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, I love Chuck Close and his photo-realist paintings. But I have to work.

Quote.Speaker: Alex
Quote.Text: Uh, well, actually there's something else I'd love to talk to you about. Can we go somewhere else to talk about it?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: OK.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's it. I want to talk to this guy. Put me in his ear.

Quote.Speaker: Alex
Quote.Text: [in private office] Um.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What's up?

Quote.Speaker: Alex
Quote.Text: I'm gonna take a big leap and I want to tell you that I think you should not move back to Scranton.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm gonna make a bigger leap here. He is into you.

Quote.Speaker: Alex
Quote.Text: Why did you come to New York in the first place?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Because they have a great design program, and I wanted to see if I was any good at it. And I wanted to work on my art, too.

Quote.Speaker: Alex
Quote.Text: Right. And that's why I think that you should stay here. Because I mean, you -- really you just got here, you know? You can't do New York in three months. You know, it has everything. It has -- all the opportunity is here. All the -- the whole art scene is in New York. You know, it would be nuts to go back to Scranton without getting to fully experience it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Jim's in Scranton.

Quote.Speaker: Alex
Quote.Text: I know. But all I'm saying is, if there's even a teeny, tiny part of you that really wants to be an artist, then I think you should stay here, because you don't want to wake up in 50 years and look back and wonder what could have been. And that is the end of my speech. I planned it all. Anyway ... I will see you tomorrow.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'll see you tomorrow.

Quote.Speaker: Alex
Quote.Text: OK. [Pam and Jim look worried]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Is that the Matsuhashi B-400? The world's tiniest Bluetooth? [reaches toward Jim's ear] May I?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Don't.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Congratulations on choosing Schrute Farms for your wedding.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: We haven't decided on anything yet. We're still reviewing some options, and it's gonna come down to the numbers.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, then. Why don't you look over some of our materials? [opens album]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh. Hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [looking at Angela] While I describe to you the Excalibur package. In addition to the breathtaking natural beauty and smell of Schrute Farms, I can promise you that our grounds can be catered to fit your exact specifications. [Angela smiles] I will work tirelessly for you over the coming months and be at your constant disposal. [Andy moves his head into Dwight's view] Please feel free to call or stop by, any time of the day or night.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That's very generous.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: While you, my good friend, have nothing more to worry about. This wedding is officially out of your hands.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, thank the good Lord. Deal! [shakes Dwight's hand]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: OK.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Um, what are we talking price wise?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You already said deal.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Pay him whatever he wants.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Can't argue with that. Dwight ... [takes Angela's hand] You are going to make us so happy. [Dwight and Angela grin at each other]

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Come on, how did you propose? Spill it. Were you wasted?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How did I propose, let me see... well, I drove her up to Nashua, and I had the ring, a big 10-carat diamond; it was beautiful. And I got down on my hands and knees, and a shooting star crossed overhead, and it just lit up the diamond like a shooting star. And we were in a restaurant, and I put the diamond into a cheeseburger.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin & Andy
Quote.Text: Ooooh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And she took a bite, started to choke. So what do I do? I have CPR training. Go around, start doing the Heimlich.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Perfect.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: The ring, 10-carat diamond, pops out of her mouth, hits her shrimp cocktail, right onto her finger. Million-to-one shot. All of the Greek people in the restaurant start screaming "Opa!" Which means "congratulations," so...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, man!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [in Jim's ear] Ask how he's doing since the breakup.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So, how you holdin' up?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm pretty much devastated.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ask if there's anything you can do.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know what you should do? Take a vacation.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Maybe go to Sandals, Jamaica. Or the other Sandals, Jamaica. I just don't want to go by myself.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Tell him you'd like to go with him.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We should take a look at those surveys.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why are surveys important? Okay, hypothetical:

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Great marks, Phyllis. [Phyllis walks out of Michael's office smiling]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: [to Stanley] Hey, I did good too!

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I knew it. Haha! [they high five]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [hand up, seeking a high five] Up! Don't leave me hangin'! [they do]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What do I do with my bonus check? [scoffs] Simple. Purchase paper from myself. Boosts my sales, which boosts my bonus. Last year I bought even more paper to make this year's bonus even bigger. Eventually, I'll get a bonus so big I can retire on it. And I'll use the paper to write my memoirs.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I taught Jim and Dwight everything I know about sales. But there are certain things that cannot be taught, and it is these things that I now must teach them.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Attention, all problem sales persons. Jim Halpert... Dwight Schrute...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [raises hand] Here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Intensive one-on-one retraining will begin after lunch. That is all.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I am no longer the worst salesman in the office. Yes! [Andy gestures excitedly, knocking over his coffee mug] Ow! Dammit!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight and I are both writing letters to our clients. I'm just sending a quick note to say how much I appreciate their business, and he is writing notarized letters to inform them them that lying on customer reviews is a prosecutable form of fraud and defamation. It's just... different styles.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: My job is to manipulate the customer into buying paper. In return, they give me money. I am the predator and they are the prey. Would a mouse give a positive review to a hawk? Should the hawk even care? [sighs heavily, nearly starts to cry] Excuse me, I've got work to do.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [laughs heartily and passes a newspaper to Phyllis]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: [laughing] It's good!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey, what are you laughing at?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley & Phyllis
Quote.Text: [continue to laugh]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Are you laughing at me?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: We're laughing at this cartoon! [passes newspaper to Dwight]

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Perfect, isn't it?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [looks at cartoon] How is that funny? What are you really laughing at? Huh?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Haven't you been following the news? Ther university is using its non-profit status to fund its private real estate investments.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [laughing louder] And he really nailed them on it. Somebody's finally holding them accountable!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [looking at cartoon] There's no way you're laughing at this.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [peering nervously through conference room window] Oh, I don't have anything to say. I'm just hiding from Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [is seen taking apart his phone receiver to check for listening devices]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's good to be paranoid. People need to be more paranoid. Case in point, JFK. If I had been JFK, I would have seen all three gunmen. I would have pulled out my concealed Luger and fired first. Man in book depository, BOOM! Grassy knoll, BOOM! Fake Jackie, BOOM! [pretends to kiss, then shoot imaginary person to his left] Then I shoot myself, so I don't change history and create a paradox. BOOM! But right at the last minute, [contorts head sideways] I twist out of the way of the bullet. Nice try, history. Better luck next year.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So, as it turns out, Dwight is right. How bizarre.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [in Jim's ear] I wonder what else Dwight's been right about....

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Major pharmaceuticals do not want you to know that beet juice has medicinal value both as an aphrodisiac and a laxative.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The Scranton Zoning Board has a strong bias against beet farmers. The mayor is in the pocket of Big Lettuce.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Battlestar Galactica isn't a documentary exactly.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The book All The President's Men is about a conspiracy, just not the one people think.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jesus had a daughter, and she was the Mona Lisa.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What we have come to know as fake crab meat is in fact real crab meat, and real crab meat is lobster.
